description: Calculate the minimum ratio of binding energy between accretor models and single stars of the same total post-RLOF mass.
instructions: Using MESA (version 15140) with the same parameters as the paper (Z = 0.0019, initial period P = 100 days, and initial masses (M1, M2) = (18, 15), (20, 17), (38, 30) M☉), calculate the binding energy profiles of both the accretor models and single star models of equivalent post-RLOF mass. Evolve the models to R = 500 R☉ and calculate the ratio of binding energies (accretor/single) as a function of radius. Find the minimum ratio value for each of the three mass configurations. Return the three minimum ratio values.
output_justification: These values are from the paper's findings in Section 3, where they state that the minima range between 0.56-0.07, 0.58-0.08, and 0.51-0.04 from their least to most massive binary, specifically at R = 500 R☉.
